summary.long: 1 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ,
To those who are elect exiles of the dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in the sanctification of the Spirit, for obedience to Jesus Christ and for sprinkling with his blood:
May grace and peace be multiplied to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who by God's power are being guarded through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this you rejoice, though now for a little while, if necessary, you have been grieved by various trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the tested genuineness of your faith—more precious than gold that perishes though it is tested by fire—may be found to result in praise and glory and honour at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though you have not seen him, you love him. Though you do not now see him, you believe in him and rejoice with joy that is inexpressible and filled with glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: obtaining the outcome of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied about the grace that was to be yours searched and enquired carefully,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: enquiring what person or time the Spirit of Christ in them was indicating when he predicted the sufferings of Christ and the subsequent glories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was revealed to them that they were serving not themselves but you, in the things that have now been announced to you through those who preached the good news to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven, things into which angels long to look.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, preparing your minds for action, and being sober-minded, set your hope fully on the grace that will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As obedient children, do not be conformed to the passions of your former ignorance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but as he who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since it is written, “You shall be holy, for I am holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you call on him as Father who judges impartially according to each one's deeds, conduct yourselves with fear throughout the time of your exile,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that you were ransomed from the futile ways inherited from your forefathers, not with perishable things such as silver or gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with the precious blood of Christ, like that of a lamb without blemish or spot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was foreknown before the foundation of the world but was made manifest in the last times for the sake of you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who through him are believers in God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having purified your souls by your obedience to the truth for a sincere brotherly love, love one another earnestly from a pure heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you have been born again, not of perishable seed but of imperishable, through the living and abiding word of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for
“All flesh is like grass
    and all its glory like the flower of grass.
The grass withers,
    and the flower falls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the word of the Lord remains for ever.”
And this word is the good news that was preached to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So put away all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like newborn infants, long for the pure spiritual milk, that by it you may grow up into salvation—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you come to him, a living stone rejected by men but in the sight of God chosen and precious,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you yourselves like living stones are being built up as a spiritual house, to be a holy priesthood, to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it stands in Scripture:
“Behold, I am laying in Zion a stone,
    a cornerstone chosen and precious,
and whoever believes in him will not be put to shame.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the honour is for you who believe, but for those who do not believe,
“The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone”,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and
“A stone of stumbling,
    and a rock of offence.”
They stumble because they disobey the word, as they were destined to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession, that you may proclaim the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvellous light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once you were not a people, but now you are God's people; once you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, I urge you as sojourners and exiles to abstain from the passions of the flesh, which wage war against your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep your conduct among the Gentiles honourable, so that when they speak against you as evildoers, they may see your good deeds and glorify God on the day of visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be subject for the Lord's sake to every human institution, whether it be to the emperor as supreme,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or to governors as sent by him to punish those who do evil and to praise those who do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of God, that by doing good you should put to silence the ignorance of foolish people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Live as people who are free, not using your freedom as a cover-up for evil, but living as servants of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honour everyone. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the emperor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all respect, not only to the good and gentle but also to the unjust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is a gracious thing, when, mindful of God, one endures sorrows while suffering unjustly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what credit is it if, when you sin and are beaten for it, you endure? But if when you do good and suffer for it you endure, this is a gracious thing in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to this you have been called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, so that you might follow in his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He committed no sin, neither was deceit found in his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was reviled, he did not revile in return; when he suffered, he did not threaten, but continued entrusting himself to him who judges justly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we might die to sin and live to righteousness. By his wounds you have been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were straying like sheep, but have now returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, wives, be subject to your own husbands, so that even if some do not obey the word, they may be won without a word by the conduct of their wives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they see your respectful and pure conduct.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let your adorning be external—the braiding of hair and the putting on of gold jewellery, or the clothing you wear—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but let your adorning be the hidden person of the heart with the imperishable beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which in God's sight is very precious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is how the holy women who hoped in God used to adorn themselves, by submitting to their own husbands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord. And you are her children, if you do good and do not fear anything that is frightening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, husbands, live with your wives in an understanding way, showing honour to the woman as the weaker vessel, since they are heirs with you of the grace of life, so that your prayers may not be hindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, all of you, have unity of mind, sympathy, brotherly love, a tender heart, and a humble mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not repay evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary, bless, for to this you were called, that you may obtain a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“Whoever desires to love life
    and see good days,
let him keep his tongue from evil
    and his lips from speaking deceit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let him turn away from evil and do good;
    let him seek peace and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
    and his ears are open to their prayer.
But the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now who is there to harm you if you are zealous for what is good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if you should suffer for righteousness' sake, you will be blessed. Have no fear of them, nor be troubled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in your hearts honour Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defence to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you; yet do it with gentleness and respect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a good conscience, so that, when you are slandered, those who revile your good behaviour in Christ may be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is better to suffer for doing good, if that should be God's will, than for doing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ also suffered once for sins, the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh but made alive in the spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which he went and proclaimed to the spirits in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they formerly did not obey, when God's patience waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight persons, were brought safely through water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baptism, which corresponds to this, now saves you, not as a removal of dirt from the body but as an appeal to God for a good conscience, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God, with angels, authorities, and powers having been subjected to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since therefore Christ suffered in the flesh, arm yourselves with the same way of thinking, for whoever has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as to live for the rest of the time in the flesh no longer for human passions but for the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time that is past suffices for doing what the Gentiles want to do, living in sensuality, passions, drunkenness, orgies, drinking parties, and lawless idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With respect to this they are surprised when you do not join them in the same flood of debauchery, and they malign you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they will give account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is why the gospel was preached even to those who are dead, that though judged in the flesh the way people are, they might live in the spirit the way God does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The end of all things is at hand; therefore be self-controlled and sober-minded for the sake of your prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show hospitality to one another without grumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whoever speaks, as one who speaks oracles of God; whoever serves, as one who serves by the strength that God supplies—in order that in everything God may be glorified through Jesus Christ. To him belong glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery trial when it comes upon you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rejoice insofar as you share Christ's sufferings, that you may also rejoice and be glad when his glory is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are insulted for the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer or a thief or an evildoer or as a meddler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if anyone suffers as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God in that name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is time for judgement to begin at the household of God; and if it begins with us, what will be the outcome for those who do not obey the gospel of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And
“If the righteous is scarcely saved,
    what will become of the ungodly and the sinner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let those who suffer according to God's will entrust their souls to a faithful Creator while doing good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I exhort the elders among you, as a fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, as well as a partaker in the glory that is going to be revealed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shepherd the flock of God that is among you, exercising oversight, not under compulsion, but willingly, as God would have you; not for shameful gain, but eagerly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not domineering over those in your charge, but being examples to the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the unfading crown of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, you who are younger, be subject to the elders. Clothe yourselves, all of you, with humility towards one another, for “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God so that at the proper time he may exalt you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sober-minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resist him, firm in your faith, knowing that the same kinds of suffering are being experienced by your brotherhood throughout the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after you have suffered for a little while, the God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him be the dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Silvanus, a faithful brother as I regard him, I have written briefly to you, exhorting and declaring that this is the true grace of God. Stand firm in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She who is at Babylon, who is likewise chosen, sends you greetings, and so does Mark, my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Greet one another with the kiss of love.
Peace to all of you who are in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator
